website_summaries.verdict: High tech monitor that is perfect for runners, by tracking much more than just heart rate.
pros: Connects to over 50 popular smart phone apps
ANT+ and Bluetooth 4.0 technology helps it connect to newer and older GPS, iPhone and Android devices
Able to track distance and speed while running on a treadmill
cons: Some customers commented that it is more complicated to use than most heart rate monitors

customer_reviews.title: This is a good unit with poor quality parts that fail easily
customer_reviews.text: The unit works fine but the strap is by far the worst I have had amongst a dozen or so Garmin and Polar straps. After a few months the metal clasps that are on the strap just snapped off and rendered the unit useless. On closer inspection it is apparent that the load bearing is on these clasps as this is where the unit clips together. These metal clasps do not handle the necessary stress that is applied to them. I have tried getting help from Wahoo on this as well as a faulty cadence sensor but they just do not reply. I would therefore not recommend buying this as the value for money is hopeless
customer_reviews.author: John Uppard

customer_reviews.title: All the features you could ever want...but lacking in durability.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this thing. But I've gone through four of them and they work inconsistently at best. Don't waste your money. Maybe the new generation is better.
customer_reviews.author: 80_six

customer_reviews.title: Decent monitor and app but terrible Bluetooth support and poor quality, uncomfortable strap
customer_reviews.text: Having used this product hundreds of times over the last 18 months: Pros: Good accuracy when connected Bluetooth and ANT+ support Wahoo Fitness app exports to many 3rd party services like MyFitnessPal Offline workout mode Cons: Bluetooth connection times are maddeningly inconsistent, ranging from 3 seconds to 5 minutes Heartrate monitoring sometimes stops for 30 seconds to 2 minutes mid workout No workout profile for elliptical machines Strap is poor quality and corroded quickly (picture is of my 2nd, replacement strap) Wahoo Fitness app for Android doesn't support landscape mode 7 minute workout app only works on old versions of Android (sorry Nexus/Pixel/Pixel 2 users)
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for a couple of times. You receive accurate information about your workout. Easy to pair with Strava. Easy to use and practical.It has Bluetooth connection and a battery that is easy to change.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Used my new Wahoo heart rate monitor for a month (and loved it!) before I started having issues. Contact customer service via email, after going through the troubleshooting tips on their website, with no success. Their customer service team walked me through additional steps to try, given that anytime you are working with bluetooth / wifi there can be issues. They resolved the issue quickly and I greatly appreciate the support I was given. Obviously, we never want to purchase a product that doesn't work, but it happens. Due to their outstanding support, I do not hesitate to recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: GMarkus

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: Husband bought me a 2nd one as I loved it the first time which it lasted less than 1yr. This time it lasted 5 months and the click strap broke, Im not heavy and only use it when spinning so I wasn't rough with it. Amazon only gives you 30 days to return it and of course it works form 30 days, AMAZON doesn't even replace it...I don't understand why they sell this and not offer their clients an exchange. the actual manufacture doesn't even respond. After spending almost $80 and only lasting a few months its not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: daisy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome option for anyone on a budget for a all in one tracker
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money for someone looking for a cheaper option then a tracker that goes on your wrist. If you have a smart phone this is your next best option. Have used in conjunction with Apple Watch 4 and hold within 1-2 bpm with the watch on the heart rate.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Allen Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: Heart rate strap works great. Easy to pair...I've paired with my phone, watch, and ergometer. App is pretty good too where you can share your workout information amongst multiple other fitness apps. I've used without my phone or watch nearby and the memory works really well - downloads my workout after. It's been comfortable to wear. I've worn it indoors and outdoors for running, spinning, rowing on water, and rowing indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Carmie

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Until It Doesn't
customer_reviews.text: I use my Tickr X mostly for cycling, and occasionally for running. The strap gets stretched out easily and needs constant adjustment, the electrode/snaps corrode very easily and quickly. Eventually, you'll start going through batteries quicker and quicker for some reason, and then the little o-ring around the battery cover will wear out and the whole thing will get corroded and stop working entirely. Customer service will give you a 20% coupon for your troubles, but how hard would it be to have for sale (or free) extra battery covers or o-rings? All-in-all, it's a decent HRM if you're looking for Bluetooth capability, but expect to replace it regularly. The Garmin duo is a much better design for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W.

customer_reviews.title: YOU NEED AN IPHONE TO USE TREADMILL FEATURE !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't use all the features using my Samsung note8 . The one thing I bought this HR monitor was for the treadmill feature but I needed an Iphone to use that the treadmill and a couple other features. I have an iPad but again it would only work with an iPhone . So instead of the 79.99 dollar unit your better go getting the 49.99 dollar unit if you don't have an iPhone .
customer_reviews.author: oneshot

customer_reviews.title: Great first five minutes..... then useless.
customer_reviews.text: It looked good. It was comfortable to wear. It was easy to pair. But after five minutes, it disconnects from the bluetooth and the strap needs to be unsnapped and put back on to get it to reconnect. Basically the connection was completely unreliable. We never made it off the couch because the connection was so erratic while sitting down with my phone in front of me. Also, while it was connected, my heart would stop for several minutes at a time... or at least that's what the sensor indicated. Instructions included were very poor/useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ber

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I just received this item today, new in the box, and It does not turn on. Whether the product is defective or it needs a new battery (at this point, I do not which is the fact), it is unacceptable for a new device. I have followed all instructions per the quick start guide in the box and online. I have been trying to get it to work for an hour now. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Garmin app and watch
customer_reviews.text: I do not use the app that comes with it (Wahoo). This strap sync'd quickly with my Garmin Fenix 5s and iPhoneX with Garmin app. I use the strap when I need my HR to be tracked more accurately (high intensity workouts, running, strenuous hiking) then with just the wrist based tracking on my watch. Wrist based is fine for lower intensity workouts or activities, but sometimes you need more accuracy with a chest strap.
customer_reviews.author: kjm27434

customer_reviews.title: Nice sensor made almost useless by the software
customer_reviews.text: Among the positives, when it works, it works well. The strap is more comfortable and stays in position better than I expected. Data can be easily viewed and exported to Excel or other formats. The BIG problem is the software. I bought this system for it's memory and storage. I didn't want to be carrying my phone when I used it. When the sensor is active and the software connected, downloading prior sessions is automatic. Sometimes it works. Too many times it doesn't. There needs to be a means for seeing the workouts stored in the sensor and a way to force a download.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months -- But strap replaced free of charge promptly
customer_reviews.text: Worked -- great -- until the fastener broke off of the band after 4 months (an hour a day on a treadmill, 6 days/wk) when unsnapping the unit. Others have pointed out this issue in the reviews -- I probably should have listened. Avoid. I will update my review if I can get some satisfaction from Wahoo. EDIT: Wahoo sent out a prompt replacement for the band. Updating to 3 stars. Still, I think the use of a snap rather than a hook is a design flaw
customer_reviews.author: Michael Owings

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't stay in place, tapping function not always working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of a health condition. I wanted constant heart rate monitoring. I did lots of research and settled on this one. Problem 1 was the tapping to start a work out did not always work. It looks ridiculous when you are trying to stare under your bra beneath your shirt looking for blinking lights. Also, I have a slim, but "figure 8" body type. I placed the monitor where it said to, but it slipped down no matter ho tight i tried it. Also, my regular bra was constantly pushing it down when sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn d

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with this brand.
customer_reviews.text: I originally bough this due to all the other features of the HR monitor but I found myself using the app less due to my Garmin Forerunner pretty much told me the same thing. Still a great Heart Rate monitor no real dislikes and I'm confident saying that this brand is one of the best on the market. Likes: 1. comfort - stays in place fairly well even after using it for ever 400 miles. 2. Sturdy/durable - after a lot of use in a very humid summer strap and device has held up. 3. Seems pretty accurate
customer_reviews.author: Shipwrecked

customer_reviews.title: It will last a year.
customer_reviews.text: This is at least my 4th, and now, last Wahoo HRM chest strap. I’ve had the original, Run and X models, and they all have died just outside the warranty window. First they start burning through batteries and then they’re just done. When they work, they’re great. Also, the newest version chest strap that came with the X model slips/loosens more than any of the previous models as well. Finally, I dropped extra cash on the X model to work with Wahoo’s 7 Minute Workout, but they sold the app and now it doesn’t integrate. :( Done with Wahoo products.
customer_reviews.author: c.kernaghan

customer_reviews.title: Never works correctly and sudenly stops working $79+tax to the trash
customer_reviews.text: I had heard good reviews, so that's why I was encouraged to buy this one, But it never worked correctly the Bluetooth does not connect easily, suddenly it stops sending signal, the elastic of the belt loses resistance after a short time, suddenly it stopped working, I changed the battery, I did several things and it worked again, and it did it again but it no longer works, I buy it at the end of December and a month ago it stopped working, it is useless. I Do Not Recommend. $79+tax to the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar D.

customer_reviews.title: Came used and broke within days
customer_reviews.text: I believe this item was used. First, the packaging wasn’t sealed then once I set it up, I found a workout on it from 2017. It’s pretty good. It tries to start a workout right when I put it on even though I just want to check my heart rate. It seems best to open the app I want to use and then put it on. I’m extra careful with my stuff, but I’ve had it for less than a week and a piece already broke off. I ordered a replacement to give it another try. I enjoy using it because it seems way more accurate and consistent than my Apple Watch 4.
customer_reviews.author: jDeppen

customer_reviews.title: I highly regret wasting my money on this.
customer_reviews.text: The GPS readings on the app were almost a kilometer off from Strava, Nike Run, and my Apple watch. The others would be within .1 km of each other but using Wahoo's fitness app it was .7-.9 km off which really shows a difference in my pace. Now I feel like I have to decide if heart rate or pace is more important...haha. I had a lot of high hopes for this device. Edit Now Wahoo fitness or the ticker keeps recording 2-7 multiple duplicate entries in apples Activity app, the heart beat gets stuck, and the gps has gotten worse.
customer_reviews.author: Jin

customer_reviews.title: Good device, but disappointing that it was used
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I will admit that this is my first heart rate monitor, but the TICKR X does what I want and fits well. I'm only giving 4 stars b/c mine came obviously used, which is disappointing. I noticed that not only did mine come with wear marks where the batter cover is (showing that someone had changed the battery), but also the battery was low power when I got it. To add, I noticed that my particular TICKR had a log of about 3 months worth of workouts already on the saved settings. Disappointing, but I will say that the packaging and band were new, so that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: T. Allison

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. There was a point where I was having trouble getting connectivity between the app and the belt without deleting the prior connection and reestablishing it as a new connection, but that was quickly taken care of by a subsequent update to app. This is a solid product and I like how I can have it connected by Bluetooth to my phone and the app while at the same time being connected by Ant+ to my wrist device. Belt and suspenders, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth is impossible to connect
customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth on this heart rate monitor is terrible. It will not connect to my Iphone. It did for about three weeks. Than suddenly stopped. I changed the battery numerous times, and still, no deal. The design itself is crappy. I have a polar, which is pretty much flawless. Maybe a smart attorney will start a class action suit against Wahoo, for this product, and other ones that fail to deliver what is promised. Numerous battery changes, moisten the belt, etc, etc, etc. AVOID
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: They keep breaking!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Wahoo chest strap. I bought the first one in 2015. It lasted until March 2019. Not bad, but I would have expected at least 5 years for the price. I bought my second one in March 2019. It gave me an occasional inaccurate reading, but overall it wasn't bad, until today, December 13th 2019 when it just stopped working after only nine months. My recommendation? Don't buy a Wahoo chest strap, they are junk.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Won’t connect to Apple watch
customer_reviews.text: Could not get it to connect to my Apple Watch. Struggled for a couple of days to get it to work including pulling the battery several times and had no luck. Seemed to work with their apps ok and connected to my phone but I really wanted it to connect to my watch.
customer_reviews.author: Steveostevestevenson

customer_reviews.title: Solid, easy, accurate - but don't expect cadence to work outside of Wahoo products
customer_reviews.text: Solid, easy, accurate, affordable heart rate tracker. No complaints; it does what it claims to, affordable, and appears it can take a beating. You can run / work out untethered from your phone, which makes it even better. The ONLY warning is this: the cadence data is NOT available for any apps outside of Wahoo apps. Do not expect (barring changes in the APIs / software) Wahoo cadence data to be available to TrainerRoad, Strava, iSmoothRun, or other apps. Highly recommended for what it is, when you use it for what it can do.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J Schnack

customer_reviews.title: It's only for BPM
customer_reviews.text: Got the Tickr X so I wouldn't have to carry my phone with me. The memory works fine, but be aware the Tickr X will only record pulse rate (BPM). Other functions which are recorded (e.g., with the Wahoo phone app) use the sensors in the phone. The Wahoo app for android is not as far along and does not have all of the functions that are available for iPhones. I suggest you read up on the Wahoo site to see the differences. Sometimes I get erroneous BPM values. For example, when I first put it on, it often reads 120-ish for a while even though my pulse (measured with tried and true methods) is closer to 60-70.
customer_reviews.author: B. H. Suits

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Arrived earlier than forecast in sound outer and inner packaging with zero damage to either. The product synched easily with my Garmin Fenix 5X. I haven't used the WAHOO App yet as I use Garmin Connect. However I did download and set up the WAHOO App which was pretty straightforward. I ordered 3 for my pals and myself. They are both super-happy with theirs as well. Good value / accurate / works / comfortable - As long as it lasts, what more could I wish for? Thanks WAHOO Team - Very cool indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Iain Brymer

customer_reviews.title: memory is the reason to buy this one
customer_reviews.text: I can do my workout without carrying another device (phone, watch, etc.) and then download the exercise data later -- for the way I exercise that's a significant benefit. As far as a HRM strap, it works well and is compatible with many different platforms. But most other major brands do the same. This is my second TickrX unit (first lasted about 3 years, used almost every day).
customer_reviews.author: D. B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Erroneous Pace Readings
customer_reviews.text: When running between five and six miles per hour the tickr often indicates erroneous speeds. The Garmin foot fob is much more consistent at tracking pace. I use the Wahoo app to track my runs. In the Wahoo app I could not disable the app from using the pace data from the tickr and use the Garmin instead. When using heart rate monitors that only have heart rate you can use the Garmin for pace. Since I could not get valid pace data I have returned the tickr.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: worked twice
customer_reviews.text: So, i was excited about getting a heart rate monitor on my chest. I use a fitbit so i wanted to see how they compared. Well, the 2 times the wahoo worked, it matched the fitbit heart rate almost exactly. I think that actually bods well for the fitbit. But, after only two times, the unit is now not registering my heart rate. It connects to bluetooth, but the red light doesn't blink so i have no heart rate. two time of use and that was it. I have moved it around on my chest to try different areas - and it still didn't work. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: dchorton

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor out there
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I use this with my Samsung Health App and love the fact that it tracks with many different exercises and apps. Additionally, if I forget to track with one app, the memory will keep my workout until I download to the Wahoo App on my iPad. I do not use the Wahoo 7 minute app as I do not like it at all. After using many different set ups and monitors, this is the best. Plus if you like to swim, it is waterproof to a short depth. Now I am ordering one for my hubby to track his lack of exercise. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaholic

customer_reviews.title: Battery life false
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the cell battery twice since purchasing this in Nov. 2019. It was a Christmas gift for my husband so it wasn't actually used until Jan. 2020. It had a one year warranty so I don't know why I can't return it as now id doesn't work at all. Purchased an additional 3 yr. protection policy but don't see why I should use it when it's been less than a year. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When it connects...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work OK though it seems almsot fantastical how much you can burn staying in your target zone. I'm deducting the Stars because the bluetooth connection gets pretty finicky. I usually have some difficulties getting it work when I first put hte monitor on. It can take a few tries for it to turn on/connect with the phone. It's definitely annoying. Edit: As more time passes, getting extremely frustrated with the blue tooth connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: T. Verghese

customer_reviews.title: Wahoo Tickr X
customer_reviews.text: I have found the tickr x very easy to use, pairs up to iphone in less than 30 seconds every time. No glitches or dropped portions of my ride. Start up instructions are truly inadequate. I have figured it out but not due to factory instructions. For a product so advanced from others you would think that the entire menu navigation would be available to the cunsumer in text. With some experience and common sense you will figuire the tickr x out. Good product. I am very happy with the purchace of tickr x.
customer_reviews.author: scott harder

customer_reviews.title: Not great for the gym
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this product is better for outdoor activities, but not in the gym. It doesn't talk to any of the machines to show heart rate on the display, something my polar strap has no problem doing. The connection frequently disconnects and connects and interrupts music telling you so. Lastly I had to run the diagnostic tool multiple times to get the speed numbers to work. All in all im very disappointed and would return it for a refund if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Would like consistancy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pair
customer_reviews.text: purchased this so that I can see how many calories I burn during my zumba classes and monitor does an excellent job. It is comfortable and easy to pair with the app. After a lot of use, the band kind of stretched out where the clasp isn’t holding the extra fabric, so I stick the extra band fabric under my sports bra. I would still recommend the heart monitor!
customer_reviews.author: Ames Eggerbee

customer_reviews.title: only lasts a year...
customer_reviews.text: Just adding my voice to the choir that this product works very well but only lasts about a year or so. This is my third TICKR X and last. I have purchased one every year. They just stop working: strap falls apart, battery casing corrodes. It's just a poorly made product. Hopefully Wahoo will hear the music and come up with a durable version 2. Until then it is a Garmin monitor next
customer_reviews.author: Ben Loveless

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless and frustrating
customer_reviews.text: This unit failed to connect to my iPhone majority of time. On the few times it did work this would have been after10 minutes of tapping, wetting/re-wetting electrodes, resetting Bluetooth. It also was incredibly inaccurate - reading my heart rate more than 50 bpm greater than my Apple Watch and manual measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Enkay Ochez

customer_reviews.title: Tracking indoor bike, elliptical, and 7 minute workout
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this product 5 stars but deducted one because it is very hard to get information from Wahoo. I knew I could track my indoor bike using the Wahoo Fitness app but I could not find out how to track the elliptical at the gym. The website gave virtually no help. I finally found that there is another Wahoo app called RunFit which will not only track the elliptical but workouts as well. So it is a fine product and it is well worth wearing a strap. The heart rate monitor is very precise and registers the exact same rate as my oximeter.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Merrill

customer_reviews.title: It pairs fine with the Wahoo app
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble getting this to pair with Runkeeper on my Galaxy Note 4. It pairs fine with the Wahoo app, just problematic with Runkeeper. It also works fine with Endomondo which is ANT+ compatible on the GN4. Note I got it on sale during the holiday 12 days sale and at the price I paid for it, it works well. I like it because it's both ANT+ which makes it work with my Fenix 3HR. With another brand of phone the LE BT may pair nicely as well.
customer_reviews.author: TREX

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Described
customer_reviews.text: I really appreacite what wahoo stands for. I started with a KICKR snap and have ended up with a whole repertoire of items. The TICKR picks up heart rate plain and simple. Additionally, I really like being able to double tap to change songs. It’s an awesome feature when working hard on the trainer. The strap is washable which is obviously necessary. I have no complaints so far
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bourg

customer_reviews.title: It failed
customer_reviews.text: Well it was ok until about a week ago, now it has failed. It reads super high heart rates, that are erratic and inconsistent. I have compared to my Apple Watch heart monitor. Very disappointing it has failed within two years of ownership.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty badly for 2 weeks and then completely malfunctioned to where it is unusable at this point. The heart rate monitor is spazzing out giving readings of 120 bpm when my heart rate is 60. Even when it was working I couldn't trust the readings and it would drop data if I breathed too deeply. The device itself is not intuitive. I can't tell when it's on or not. There aren't instructions readily available and there is 0 troubleshooting for the malfunctioning issue I dealt with. Do not buy & I plan on returning.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great on its own. Problematic with multiple BT devices.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, assuming you have only one device it could connect to. I use an Apple Watch and an iPhone for various different workouts. In order for it to reliably stay connected to the one I want, I have to disable Bluetooth on the other. If I don’t, it randomly flips back and forth. The worst part is that it can look like it’s working for a few minutes and then you get to the end of the workout and you realize it switched to the other device. I really hope they figure this problem out for the next version.
customer_reviews.author: Pgh Runner

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with other Wahoo products like the Cadence tracker.
customer_reviews.text: When used alone, the monitor works fairly accurately. But do not buy it if you intend on using with with other Wahoo products. I’ve gone round and round with customer warranty support to try to get this to work with the Wahoo cadence monitor. That also works individually fairly well. But these cannot be used as an ensemble. Warranty supports say they can ... they even sent me another one to test out. That doesn’t work either. It’s very frustrating because they won’t offer a refund for this purchased monitor. I now just use my Apple Watch for heart rate tracking. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Shotwell

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable connection
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing more fun then getting all ready for a run or a ride, getting all pumped up....and then sitting around for 20 minutes trying to get your HR monitor to connect. That's the story about half the time with this for me. Just spent 20 minutes trying to get it connected and couldn't get a reading from 3 different devices before giving up because I guess it just doesn't feel like syncing up today.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Not great connection to app
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for a few months and have found the Bluetooth connection to the app to be inconsistent. Sometimes it connects immediately and other times it is a real struggle or won’t happen at all. I have an iPhone X and all the wahoo apps. Tried using the utility app and support suggestions but nothing works. There is no rhyme or reason for why one day it works and the next it doesn’t. If monitoring your heart rate isn’t that important to your fitness plan then inconsistency isn’t a big deal but I am tired of cutting workouts short just to fight with my heart rate monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, defective app, hard to use
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth the money. The pre programmed workouts do not work. Unfortunately this is the only way to see your actual heart rate. It's is very difficult to figure out how to connect. After a half hour of playing with the Bluetooth I was finally able to connect to the product. I spent 15 more minutes starting workout and it wouldn't display my heart rate.
customer_reviews.author: trevor lemmons

customer_reviews.title: Became unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Tickr x for a few years now, when it works it is very accurate. Unfortunately after a year or so the device started to act up, after the Tickr was connected to my phone or the Wahoo Elemnt the reported HR would reach random a BPM and freeze. I've had to put a new battery into the device every other week or so, I would also have to perform a reset which requires taking out the battery and putting it back in upside down for ten seconds. This often forced me to push my planned workouts back by 20-30 minutes, sometimes I would just give up on using it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: 1.5 months and strap already broke!!!
customer_reviews.text: The heart monitor is good I like that it connects to Bluetooth and does not disconnect while I work out. However it’s August 3, 2018 bought the heart rate monitor July 8, 2018 and the strap allready broke. I would really appreciate it if wahoo could replace it. Because not even two months in and the strap broke with normal use. Hopefully this can be resolved. Will update later on.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well, trying to figure out one last thing
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this monitor for about a month now. It appears to work great when tracking exercise on the Wahoo app. My only disappointment so far is, the cycles at our Gold's Gym are supposed to pick up the signal and that is not happening. I assume since the Wahoo app is picking it up, this may be an issue at the gym rather than the monitor. I also bought a Wahoo bike computer but the weather hasn't cooperated yet so I can't rate how the two connect yet.
customer_reviews.author: bedwards

customer_reviews.title: MUST USE WAHOO APP.
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to waiver your life away. Don't count on it being compatible with your workout tracking apps. Online "contract" is completely company biased (yes, some customers are lawyers who read that stuff and won't sign). You can have your proprietary data device and the intrusive device back.
customer_reviews.author: A & J Landis

customer_reviews.title: received and open box w/ no strap
customer_reviews.text: i've been wanting to try the tickr x to work w/ my wahoo elmnt roam. i guess it's sold out but i got a notice from amazon it was available and i ordered right away. unfortunately when i received the item the box was open and it was missing a strap. had to send back since i can't really use it just by holding it to my chest w/ my hands
customer_reviews.author: JFD

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! Quality & Robustness are an issue
customer_reviews.text: Only treadmill mode works, it's unable to detect heart rate if any other workout modes are selected. **** Update after 3 months of intermittent use: Device stopped working! Wahoo Fitness app on my smartphone can't connect or detect the Wahoo device. The device's lights flash fine, but cannot connect. My TimexIronman HRM device lasted years. I have reached out to their support lets see if that helps..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE and POORLY MADE
customer_reviews.text: I loved it until today when the snap broke off and could no longer be used. My husband's broke last week. We are both quite annoyed since we used them when working out. They are defective and poorly made. I contacted the company this morning (again) and hopefully they will send new ones out to us right away. Don't waste your money. See pictures below...
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: upgraded from regular Blue HR to this cuz i wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: upgraded from regular Blue HR to this cuz i wanted to see how the running smoothness could help me improve my running.. but i always get same smoothness range (50-60) no matter what i do to my ruining form .. at the end i gave up looking the numbers and using it as regular HR strap with runtastic apps.. Hope there was a guide for running smoothness
customer_reviews.author: Hithem Y. Geddeda

customer_reviews.title: Great heart rate monitor that works with many devices - but lasted less than 2 years!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to adjust fit and works great with my watch, phone and computer. Use it almost daily and so far have not had to change the battery. ***Update 3/2020 Less than two years of regular/heavy use and it is dead. Worked with support- tried reset, firmware upgrade and multiple new batteries with no luck. Best they could offer me was a discount towards a new one... $80... less than two years old... I would expect better from them.
customer_reviews.author: larrybbaker

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect at the gym where other Bluetooth device are
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device in 2018 with hopes of using this for heart rate training at the gym. This device works fine if you are out for a run, but as soon as I enter into the gym, I cannot connect it to the Wahoo app. Customer service was no help either and spent many days and exchanges with them only to have them tell me it was my phone. For the time, and frustration this product has brought me, I would not recommend it to anyone that is going to use it in gym setting.
customer_reviews.author: Bmurph213

customer_reviews.title: Loved it on my first run!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: comfortable, maintained connectivity throughout my 60 min run, App has got an awesome in-workout display, tracked my cadence and other body motion, connected to my TrainingPeaks account for seamless sharing with my coach, and I set it up to be a freaking pause/play button for my music which is so convenient . 06/30/18 Update: works great on the bike too, in-app screen choices the best and the in-workout verbal queues are extremely customizable and super helpful for keeping me focused and on-task. Cons: none yet. 06/30/18 Update: still awesome no cons!
customer_reviews.author: David Basham

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: The HRM is was super easy to pair and the quality was excellent. Overall the comfort is better than others I have used in the past. Although Wahoo offers apps, I used it with FITIV instead and the devise works flawlessly. I researched HRMs prior to buying and this seemed to suit my needs the best. I am very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: AntneeLINY

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good choice for a quality HRM
customer_reviews.text: I looked around for a quality HRM and after studying all of the various reviews I decided upon the TICKR X. I'm very satisfied with this device. I wear it while strength training with free weights and stationary equipment and also while doing extended cardio on an elliptical. It is comfortable, it stays in place, and the app seems very accurate. After 30 days of continued use I can recommend it without any hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: David R. P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate and connected to my Garmin Charlie Tactix with no problem. Each time I start an exercise on my watch, the device automatically starts tracking. I love their customer service. I had a minor issue with it and emailed them. Within 24 hours they had responded and within two days had shipped me a new one! Great team!
customer_reviews.author: Fred Sieber

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing to say the least.
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for a few months, then it just stopped. I tried everything, including changing batteries, resetting multiple times, and it simply would not work again. It would connect for a minute but show no heart rate and then it would abruptly turn off. This was very frustrating. I contacted their customer support via email on Sunday and have not heard back after a few days, so their response time is definitely slow.
customer_reviews.author: T.A. Bohlinger

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating piece of garbage!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for a few months, was never the most accurate. Now trying to get it to link with my phone is a nightmare! Spend 20 minutes with it connected and no heart rate reading. Finally get a bpm to show up and it freezes 15 minutes into the workout. I've changed batteries with the same results. Very disappointing waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great HR monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great HR monitor. I bought this to replace my Polar H7 which went missing. This unit does not have the drop outs my previous HR monitor did good stable connections. It is also more compatible with other apps. IT has good data and i really like the cadence tracking. Over all I would Highly recommend this HR monitor
customer_reviews.author: Edward Grey

customer_reviews.title: The hardware is very good, but unless they fix their software bugs or ...
customer_reviews.text: Apple Health + Apple Watch + Wahoo Apps = integration is sloppy, producing duplicates and mislabeling the types of workouts. I have had it three days and needed to manually clean the data at the end of each day. The hardware is very good, but unless they fix their software bugs or customer support replies to messages I have to give it 1/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Barrios

customer_reviews.title: Best there is
customer_reviews.text: Well honestly this is hands down the best HR monitor on the market and is recommended by many professional athletes around the world. Wahoo has put many features into this model of monitor but my favorite is the Bluetooth and ANT+ transmitting that can be used symultaneously which makes it comparable across all platforms I can’t recommend this enough !!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Works great for cycling
customer_reviews.text: My first heart rate monitor. Had it for about 6 weeks, so far it works perfectly with my wahoo elmnt bolt. I use it for bike rides 20-50 miles per ride about 5 times per week. I read a lot of reviews before buying and was worried it would not work, but it works just like it should. I have not tried it swimming nor running. I unclip the monitor and hand wash the band quickly after my rides and hang it to dry...no problems so far. It's been helpful to understand heart rate while riding especially on recovery days / low heart rate days.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: ** DO NOT BUY THIS UNIT.  IT WEARS OUT QUICKLY, COMPANY WILL NOT REPLACE **
customer_reviews.text: This Wahoo TICKR X was only the weekends and only for cycling. The snap on the end of the strap fell apart and the unit stopped working. Battery replaced and the Bluetooth signal was kaput. I contacted Wahoo customer service and offered to pay for shipping back and forth to the company as I suspected a defect. I specifically asked that they make the product better so that this doesn't become landfill. They told me to buy a new strap and did not care to look at it, or show it to engineers. They just told me to buy a new strap. No thanks!
customer_reviews.author: S.Welch

customer_reviews.title: Great Heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this couple months now, it does track my heart rate well when working out. I am not sure how accurate the app on my phone that it synchronizes too is. I think it greatly over estimates the calorie burn, but I have no way to know that for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Strasner

customer_reviews.title: Best HR Monitor I've Used So Far, Works Great with Peloton
customer_reviews.text: After six months of ownership and near daily use, I can say this is a solid HR monitor. I needed an ANT+ compatible device for the Peloton bike and this does the job perfectly. I sweat heavily and the unit has held up without issue since day one, I haven't even needed to change the battery yet. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This is a good heart monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good heart monitor for the price. In my opinion it's comfortable to wear and sometimes I forget I even have it on. I occasionally have the issues with it not syncing but it's only been once or twice and usually works within a minute or two. I find placing the sensor on my skin for 30 seconds prior to actually putting it on has made it sync right away. It seems to be accurate during my entire workout which is nice also unlike my Fitbit I used to wear that constantly stopped reading my heart rate or tell me it was in the 40's mid workout. I would recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina baldys

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to use while doing Peloton workouts. I can use it to either connect with the Peloton app or the Wahoo app. What I found with the Wahoo app is that the TICKR X captures my spin cadence just as well as my dedicated cadence sensor. The onboard memory allows you to workout without carrying your phone/tablet and download/syncs with the app later. With the free app, you can download and share data with nearly all popular fitness apps. While I’ve only had this for about 6 weeks, I’ve used it 5-6 times per week, since I purchased it, and so far it has performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: JeffP

customer_reviews.title: Best heart monitor available
customer_reviews.text: The Tickr X heart rate monitor is the best out there. It's simple to use, it pairs easily with your phone (if you have a compatible model), and the data it provides is second to none. It's accurate, complete, and detailed. You can analyze your workouts and behaviors like running cadence with a simple glance. This is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: E. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I had a Polar H7 for years and always struggled to get a readout. I could get it to pair but, even after wetting with water or gels it didn't pick up my heart rate. I put the Tickr on without wetting and I was able to pick it up and readout on 3 different devices including my Garmin biking gps, which is ANT. The Tickr is $10 less than the new Polar H10. Pay attention Polar. This is how you do it.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Mueller

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is compatible with other apps and that you can use it with bluetooth or ant+. First heart rate monitor, so I did some research before buying it. The reviews have been pretty accurate as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: So sadly to say I am highly disappointed. Only has worked once in 5 workouts
customer_reviews.text: Please make sure you have 45 minutes schedule ahead of time to get the sensor to sync. I couldn’t wait to receive item. So sadly to say I am highly disappointed. Only has worked once in 5 workouts. Returning if it don’t work again later.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a HR monitor that would compatible with both bluetooth and ANT. This has been working out very well so far. I'm pairing it with strava directly and not using the wahoo companion app. This also seamlessly syns with the Concept 2 rower - PM5 easy to use, easy to clean - all in all a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Rohyn

customer_reviews.title: Neat idea. Possibly rushed to market.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept. Terrible product. Tried to make it work, but ultimately it died. The apps tied to it are clunky and you cant manipulate the information. Eventually went with the Polar product, which is seems bulletproof and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Ed F

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this product for less than 6 months, and one of the pads on the inside of the strap which measures heart rate is already starting to fall off. I am a regular runner and cyclist using this device under normal conditions, yet it's just not holding up. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Very good heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that I can workout wth out the phone nearby and that the entire workout remains as record. Another good feature is the double tap that inserts vertical blue lines. I use that to indicate start time, laps and end time.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Olsson

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for almost two years
customer_reviews.text: I owned this device for about 23 months before it broke. In that time, I went through a few batteries and used it probably over 100 times. I would have been much more happy if this device would have lasted at least five years. The ANT+ integration was great. I was able to connect to both Zwift through a USB ANT+ dongle and my Garmin Forerunner 935. The heart rate measurements from the Wahoo HRM matched up well with the independent measurements from the Forerunner. To wake up the device, shake it heartily for a couple seconds. It wasn't immediately obvious that this was the way to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Sinnet

customer_reviews.title: ANT+ and Bluetooth Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: This is the only HRM of which I am aware that has both ANT+ and Bluetooth connectivity built in. While others have complained of these connections being dropped, I have not had that experience. My connections with my Garmin devices (through ANT+) and my Apple devices (through Bluetooth) have been stable and reliable. I cannot express an opinion on battery life yet. So far, after approximately three weeks, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Erik Larson

customer_reviews.title: Good enough.
customer_reviews.text: The device is good for its price. I have been using for keep tracking my calories and performance. To be sure about the accuracy I should have another brand to compare with, but for now looks fair. The only downside of the equipment would be the straps that after a while seems to not be holding that much. But it is overall a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hanes

customer_reviews.title: Pure Heart Rate tracking device
customer_reviews.text: This is meant for those looking for a heart rate tracking device, as the rest of the parameters like, distance run / walked, pace, etc., is not at all accurate. The manual says it is more accurate when running at a speed greater than 8km/hr. So keep this in mind while buying this device.
customer_reviews.author: John Varghese

customer_reviews.title: Great for Orange Theory Fitness
customer_reviews.text: This little gizmo works well with OTF (and will probably work well with other gyms utilizing ANT+) and I have it paired with a Polar M400 fitness watch via bluetooth at the same time. The strap is very comfortable too. Other people have concerns with the strap connectors being a little weak. I am being careful disconnecting the monitor from the strap but I'll continue to monitor that.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny967

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Terrible!!!!!!!!!!! records every other work out, im guessing it stops recording over the finest bump. Works and connects great one day and forget aboutit the next (no connection not going to connect either) Makes no sense. The original worked better only drawback is that you have to have you phone on you or close by!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Pros (kindof): The app was pretty easy to use. The strap wasn't uncomfortable. Cons: Little to no documentation/instructions on how to use. Fits awkwardly under a sports bra (any band HRM would). Battery died after a month. Once I replaced the battery the device wouldn't work. Terrible Customer Support from Wahoo. Would randomly pause during a workout so the whole workout was not recorded.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: We will see how the new one does.
customer_reviews.text: Updated 9-20-17: I reached out to customer service and they are sending me a new tracker. It may have been a faulty seal that has allowed seat to damage the internals. Original: Don't rely on this tracker. This is the second one I've owned and the second one that just stops working. Tried on multiple devices and changing the batters. Will turn on, but won't transmit and Bluetooth data or save any workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Seems accurate, integrates well and has great battery life
customer_reviews.text: Use it for all long bike rides. Integrates with my phone (RWGPS app) and my Wahoo Bolt. Battery life seems great. It has lasted since I bought it. Will download history later if I haven't used it with the app or bike computer.
customer_reviews.author: T. J.

customer_reviews.title: Never workout with it!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this heart rate monitor while cycling, running outdoors, running on a treadmill, and while playing paintball and it has provided consistent connectivity, what I assume to be accurate heart rates, and on the treadmill, very accurate stride tracking. Wahoo provides an amazing app that makes tracking workouts a breeze but also plays nicely with third-party apps as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: lack of interoperability
customer_reviews.text: I used my Polar equipment in the past as it would link up easily to the equipment at Planet fitness. This doesn't and the app is useless. It also doesn't directly link through bluetooth. It needs to be forced. On a side note I do like the heart monitor to strap interface. The lights are good to give you feedback that it isn't linked. I am going back to Polar.
customer_reviews.author: Clem Turmel

customer_reviews.title: A good product but can be finicky when connecting
customer_reviews.text: It often has trouble connecting with my Android phone and it often disconnects for seemingly no reason. However, when it does connect, which is most of the time, it's a joy to use. I like the companion app, and especially like that I can change the song playing on my phone when I double tap the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Rust issues with chest strap - twice replaced, failed
customer_reviews.text: Poor chest strap - rust issues. Second, replaced strap rusted in 2 months. All 1-Star reviews on amazon for this product more or less echo same concern. Wahoo Customer service told me to go ahead and post a poor review since they were powerless to do anything more than replace the strap within warranty period. Potentially good gadget is rendered useless by really crappy quality control. Further a Poor customer service that does not stand behind their product
customer_reviews.author: olkhicha_appa

customer_reviews.title: Updated to note its falling apart.
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of negative reviews on the functioning of this particular HRM Strap. I have had the predecessor for several years and wanted to try this one. After almost 4 weeks of daily use, it is doing exactly what I expected of it and I am quite happy with it!. UPDATE: 9 SEP 2019 The sensor pads are completely falling off the strap. I’ve used this just over a year and it’s oerfirmed perfectly BUT I am disappointed that it’s falling apart now. I will use it until I have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: RobJr

customer_reviews.title: Could be better but not bad
customer_reviews.text: Works well most of the time (sometimes it just doesn’t work and will say my heart rate is 80 when it’s 160 so that’s frustrating). The first band I ordered had a 42% battery level when I received it. I exchanged it and just got the replacement— it has a 38% battery level straight out of the box. Soooo.... yeah....
customer_reviews.author: C. McClurg

customer_reviews.title: The app software is fantastic and very user friendly and I like the concept ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work. Many reviews cited issues with the connecting and staying connected. Most of my workout today was spent trying to get an accurate and consistent HR. It just wouldn't stay sync'd throughout, I ended up taking it off and going without HR tracking during my workout. The app software is fantastic and very user friendly and I like the concept of the HRM and the product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Lasted through 1 battery change
customer_reviews.text: I used this for maybe 2 years before it gave out on me. The second time I had to replace the battery, it just would not consistently sync to my phone or read an accurate heart rate. It was either insanely high or insanely low and would change on a dime. That being said, I only gave it one star down because during that two years, it did work accurately and well, only having to re-sync to my phone a handful of times during a work out.
customer_reviews.author: Aviron7

product_meta.title: Wahoo TICKR X Heart Rate Monitor with Memory, Bluetooth/ANT+
product_meta.description: The TICKR X is the ultimate workout wearable that captures both motion and intensity to give you the most effective workout. Pair it with the Wahoo 7 Minute Workout app for a high-intensity circuit workout and automatic rep counting, or pair it with the Wahoo RunFit app for personalized heart rate training, cross-training, and additional high intensity strength training. Its built-in memory gives you the freedom to train without a phone - it captures heart rate, calorie burn, and duration from your workouts and syncs them to your phone later. TICKR X is compatible with most popular fitness apps, making it an incredibly versatile workout tracker for all of your activities. Sweatproof - Yes (hand washable strap)
feature_bullets: Personalized Heart Rate Training – workout efficiently – track and capture real-time heart rate, training zones and calories burned on your smartphone or tablet with compatible training apps.
Capture workout data and sync later - built in memory gives you the freedom to train without a phone.
Integrated with Bluetooth and ANT+, TICKR connects to smartphones, tablets, GPS watches and bike computers by Wahoo, Polar, Garmin, Apple and more.
Record workout data with the Wahoo Fitness app and automatically upload data to your favorite training platform like Strava.Strap Length: Adjustable from 23 inch to 48 inch (stretched)
Works with 50+ Smartphone Apps including Wahoo Fitness, Zwift, Runtastic, Runkeeper, UA Record, Endomondo, Peloton, Map My Run, Komoot and Nike Run Club
